items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
Higher than normal tides overnight may lead to flooding of roads and footpaths near the coast. No property flooding is expected.
The highest tide level is expected to be at Coast at North Morecambe Bay with the Sandside area at particular risk, but nearby low lying locations may also be affected, from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale at 2:30 AM on Thursday 25/07/2024. Flooding is possible two hours either side of this time.
After the high tide overnightâ€š tides remain higher than normal for the next two days but heights are reducing and we do not expect further flood alerts to be necessary after tonight's tide.
We have closed flood gates at Arnside promenade.
Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 25/07/2024, or as the situation changes.
